name: Interosseous talocalcaneal ligament
text: Interosseous talocalcaneal ligament (cervical ligament) is an intertarsal ligament that stabilizes the subtalar joint by connecting the talus to the calcaneus.

name: Calcaneocuboid/calcaneonavicular ligament
text: Bifurcate ligament is a Y-shaped intertarsal ligament from the calcaneus to the cuboid and navicular that stabilizes the midtarsal (Chopart) joint.

name: Calcaneocuboid-metatarsal ligament
text: Long plantar ligament (calcaneocuboid-metatarsal) supports the lateral longitudinal arch by spanning from the calcaneus to the cuboid and metatarsals.

name: Plantar calcaneocuboid ligament
text: Short plantar ligament (plantar calcaneocuboid) stabilizes the calcaneocuboid joint and supports the lateral longitudinal arch.

name: Plantar calcaneonavicular ligament
text: Spring ligament (plantar calcaneonavicular) supports the talar head and medial longitudinal arch by connecting the sustentaculum tali to the navicular.

name: Tarsometatarsal ligament
text: Lisfranc ligament stabilizes the tarsometatarsal complex by spanning from the medial cuneiform to the base of the second metatarsal.
